snippet: Though the amount was below danger levels, researchers warned of a small increased risk of cancers in humans.
abstract: Researchers at Johns Hopkins University say they have found levels of arsenic in chicken that exceeds amounts that occur naturally, and warn that such levels could lead to small increase in risk of cancer for consumers over a lifetime; study is to be published in journal Environmental Health Perspectives.
lead_paragraph: Though the amount was below danger levels, researchers warned of a small increased risk of cancers in humans.

headline.seo: Study Finds an Increase in Arsenic Levels in Chicken
headline.main: Study Finds an Increase in Arsenic Levels in Chicken
headline.print_headline: Study Finds an Increase in Arsenic Levels in Chicken
